H0.text: Releases heat and is endothermic is the reaction that occurs when coal burns.

H1.text: Releases heat and is exothermic is the reaction that occurs when coal burns.

H2.text: The reaction that occurs when coal burns absorbs heat and is endothermic.

H3.text: Absorbs heat and is exothermic is the reaction that occurs when coal burns.

A4.text: Combustion, or burning, is a high-temperature exothermic redox chemical reaction between a fuel (the reductant) and an oxidant, usually atmospheric oxygen, that produces oxidized, often gaseous products, in a mixture termed as smoke.

A5.text: Solid fuels, such as wood and coal, first undergo endothermic pyrolysis to produce gaseous fuels whose combustion then supplies the heat required to produce more of them.
